Level 2: E1.1 - Transition plan for climate change mitigation
Description: Description of the company’s transition plan: how its strategy and business-model align with a 1.5 °C pathway, the decarbonisation levers and key actions planned, investments and funding for implementation, assessment of locked-in GHG emissions from key assets/products, and how the plan is embedded in strategy, approved by management and being progressed.

Level 2: E1.2 - Climate-related risks and scenario analysis
Description: Disclosure of how the company’s strategy and business model are resilient to climate-related risks: the scope and methodology of resilience or scenario analysis (including physical & transition risks), how scenario analysis is used to inform risk identification/assessment, and the results of that analysis

Level 2: E1.3 - Resilience in relation to climate change
Description: How the company is able to adapt or respond over short/medium/long term to climate-related changes, how assets may be upgraded/decommissioned/reallocated, how investments in mitigation/adaptation enhance its resilience.

Level 2: E1.4 - Policies related to climate change
Description: Description of the policies adopted by the company to manage material impacts, risks and opportunities from climate change, in mitigation, adaptation, energy efficiency, renewable energy deployment and other relevant areas.

Level 2: E1.5 - Actions and resources in relation to climate change
Description: Disclosure of the key actions taken and planned in the reporting period to implement the climate-change policies, grouped by decarbonisation lever (including nature-based solutions), description of outcomes (achieved or expected GHG reductions) and the resources (CapEx, OpEx) allocated or planned for these actions.

Level 2: E1.6 - Targets related to climate change
Description: Disclosure of the climate-change targets set by the company (e.g., GHG emission reduction targets for Scope 1/2/3, intensity or absolute, renewable energy deployment, energy efficiency, adaptation) and whether/how they are aligned with a 1.5 °C pathway or science-based methodology.

Level 2: E1.7 - Energy consumption and mix
Description: Disclosure of the company’s energy consumption (total and by type) and the energy mix (i.e., share from renewable sources, fossil sources, other) to provide insight into its energy profile and transition potential.

Level 2: E1.8 - Gross Scopes 1, 2, 3 GHG emissions
Description: Disclosure of the company's gross GHG emissions (in t CO₂eq) for Scope 1 (direct emissions), Scope 2 (indirect from purchased energy) and Scope 3 (value chain emissions), and total GHG emissions, with explanation of boundaries and methodologies.

Level 2: E1.9 - GHG removals and GHG mitigation projects financed through carbon credits
Description: Disclosure of GHG removals (e.g., from carbon capture, nature-based) and mitigation projects the company has financed via carbon credits (where applicable), including volumes, methodologies and how they relate to its overall GHG strategy.

Level 2: E2.1 - Policies related to pollution
Description: Policies the company has adopted to identify, assess, manage, prevent and remediate its material impacts, risks and opportunities related to pollution of air, water and soil and the use/distribution of substances of concern and very high concern.

Level 2: E2.2 - Actions and resources related to pollution
Description: Description of the key actions taken and planned by the company to implement its pollution-related policies, including the resources (financial, human, technological) allocated or planned for their implementation.

Level 2: E2.3 - Targets related to pollution
Description: Disclosure of the pollution-related targets the company has set (or plans to set) to support its pollution policies and address material impacts, risks and opportunities, including how these targets relate to air, water and soil pollutants and substances of concern.

Level 2: E2.4 - Pollution of air, water and soil
Description: Quantitative disclosure of the company’s emissions or releases to air, water and soil in its own operations (and where relevant via the value chain), including relevant pollutants, loads, trends, measurement methodology and uncertainties.

Level 2: E2.5 - Substances of concern and substances of very high concern
Description: Disclosure of the company’s production, use, distribution, commercialisation (and imports/exports) of substances of concern (SoC) and substances of very high concern (SVHC), including relevant volumes, management measures, substitution and phase-out plans.

Level 2: E3.1 - Policies related to water
Description: Description of the policies the company has adopted to manage its material impacts, risks and opportunities related to water and marine resources (including surface water, groundwater, withdrawals, discharges, reuse), and how those policies address water use, pollution prevention, treatment, product/service design and use of marine resources.

Level 2: E3.2 - Actions and resources related to water
Description: Explanation of key actions taken and planned by the company to implement its water-and-marine-resources policies (e.g., avoid/reduce water use, reuse/recycle water, restore aquatic ecosystems), and the resources (CapEx, OpEx, human, technological) allocated or planned for those actions, including in areas of high water-risk or high-water-stress.

Level 2: E3.3 - Targets related to water
Description: Disclosure of the targets the company has adopted in relation to water and marine resources (such as water-use reduction, discharge reduction, sustainable sourcing of marine-based commodities, thresholds/allocations), including how they relate to its material impacts, risks or opportunities, whether ecological thresholds have been considered, and whether targets are mandatory or voluntary.

Level 2: E3.4 - Water metrics
Description: Description (and where applicable quantification) of the company’s performance measures related to water and marine resources that reflect its material impacts, risks and opportunities - for example: total water consumption, consumption in areas at water risk, recycled/reused water volumes, water intensity (e.g., m³ per € net revenue), quality of basins, and other relevant metrics.

Level 2: E4.1 - Transition plan for biodiversity and ecosystems
Description: Description of the company’s transition plan: how its strategy and business model are adapted to address biodiversity and ecosystem-related impacts, dependencies, risks and opportunities, how it aligns with relevant public-policy goals (e.g., the Kunming‑Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework or the EU Biodiversity Strategy for 2030), how it assesses resilience, and how the plan is embedded in governance and resource planning.

Level 2: E4.2 - Policies related to biodiversity and ecosystems
Description: Summary of the policies adopted by the company to identify, assess, manage, minimise, remediate or restore its material biodiversity and ecosystem-related impacts, dependencies, risks and opportunities - including, where relevant, traceability of raw materials and products, protection of high-biodiversity value areas, nature-based solutions, and community and indigenous knowledge considerations.

Level 2: E4.3 - Actions and resources related to biodiversity and ecosystems
Description: Description of the key actions taken and planned to implement the biodiversity and ecosystems policies, the resources allocated (financial, human, technological), how the mitigation hierarchy (avoid → reduce/minimise → restore/rehabilitate → compensate/offset) is applied (if relevant), how nature-based solutions or indigenous/local knowledge are integrated, and how progress is managed.

Level 2: E4.4 - Targets related to biodiversity and ecosystems
Description: Disclosure of the biodiversity and ecosystems-related targets set by the company (both short-, medium- and long-term), including whether the targets are aligned with ecological thresholds, relevant public-policy frameworks, how they relate to identified impacts/dependencies/risks/opportunities, their geographic scope, and how they are tracked.

Level 2: E4.5 - Metrics related to biodiversity and ecosystems change
Description: Description and where applicable quantification of performance metrics that reflect the company’s material biodiversity and ecosystem-related impacts and track progress against targets. Examples may include number/area of sites in or near biodiversity-sensitive areas, changes in ecosystem condition or connectivity, land-use change metrics, species population trends, and other indicators of ecosystem health or biodiversity status.

Level 2: E5.1 - Policies related to resource use and circular economy
Description: the company’s policies adopted to manage its material impacts, risks and opportunities relating to resource use and the circular economy, including sustainable sourcing, transition away from virgin resources, and use of recycled or renewable resources.

Level 2: E5.2 - Actions and resources related to resource use and circular economy
Description: Description of the key actions taken and planned to implement the resource use and circular economy-related policies, and the resources (CapEx, OpEx, human/technological) allocated for these actions, including circular design, reuse/repair/refurbish, and prevention of waste.

Level 2: E5.3 - Targets related to resource use and circular economy
Description: Disclosure of the targets the company has adopted linked to resource inflows/outflows (including waste, recycling, product-life extension), specifying whether these targets relate to circular design, material use rate, sustainable sourcing, or waste management, and whether ecological thresholds or mandatory/voluntary status apply.

Level 2: E5.4 - Resource Inflows
Description: Quantitative and descriptive information on the company’s resource inflows related to its material impacts, risks and opportunities - e.g., volume of materials, products or components sourced, share of recycled or secondary materials, renewable vs non-renewable inputs, and how circular economy principles are applied to these inflows.

Level 2: E5.5 - Resource outflows
Description: Disclosure regarding the company’s resource outflows - including products, materials and waste flows generated during its operations and throughout its value chain, management of waste, product-end-of-life treatment, circular business models (reuse, remanufacture, recycling) and how these outflows support the transition to circular economy.

Level 2: S1.1 - Policies related to own workforce
Description: Policies the company has adopted to manage its material impacts, risks and opportunities regarding its own workforce (employees and non-employees), including working conditions, rights, protections, and workforce-related governance.

Level 2: S1.2 - Workforce engagement, grievance channels, and remediation
Description: Description of how the company engages with employees and workers’ representatives about actual and potential workforce-related impacts, how it provides channels for its workforce to raise concerns or needs, and how it addresses or remediates issues raised.

Level 2: S1.3 - Actions and resources related to own workforce
Description: Explanation of the key actions the company has taken or plans to take regarding its own workforce (e.g., improving working conditions, training, inclusion), and the resources (financial, human, technological) allocated or planned to implement those actions.

Level 2: S1.4 - Targets related to own workforce
Description: Disclosure of the time-bound, outcome-oriented targets the company has adopted concerning its own workforce (e.g., reducing incidents, improving diversity, increasing training), aligned with material impacts, risks and opportunities.

Level 2: S1.5 - Characteristics of the company's employees
Description: Summary of key characteristics of the company’s employees (in-house workforce): number, type of employment, contract status, geographic distribution, etc., to provide context on the workforce profile.

Level 2: S1.6 - Characteristics of non-employees in the company's own workforce
Description: Summary of key characteristics of non-employee workers (e.g., contractors, agency workers, temporary staff) engaged directly by the company, including number or FTE, nature of work, how they are integrated into the workforce, and methodology of measurement.

Level 2: S1.7 - Collective bargaining coverage and social dialogue
Description: Disclosure of the extent to which working conditions and terms of employment are influenced by collective bargaining agreements and social dialogue mechanisms in the company’s workforce (especially in the EEA region).

Level 2: S1.8 - Diversity metrics
Description: Quantitative disclosure of workforce diversity metrics: e.g., gender distribution, age distribution, minorities, at various levels (board, management, workforce), to show the company’s performance on inclusion and diversity.

Level 2: S1.9 - Adequate wages
Description: Disclosure of whether all workers in the company’s own workforce are paid an adequate wage (in line with applicable benchmarks), and if not, the percentage of workers paid below the adequate wage and in which countries.

Level 2: S1.10 - Social protection
Description: Disclosure of coverage of social protection for the company’s own workers (e.g., protection against income loss due to major life events), and where coverage is lacking, the percentages and countries affected.

Level 2: S1.11 - Persons with disabilities
Description: Disclosure of the percentage of persons with disabilities in the company’s own workforce and how the company is addressing inclusion and accessibility.

Level 2: S1.12 - Training and skills development metrics
Description: Disclosure of metrics regarding training, upskilling, reskilling of the company’s workforce: e.g., number or percentage of employees trained, average hours of training, budget for training, and how this supports workforce capability.

Level 2: S1.13 - Health and Safety metrics
Description: Disclosure of health and safety indicators for the workforce: e.g., number of work-related incidents, injuries, ill-health, fatalities, coverage of safety management systems, near misses, and trends over time.

Level 2: S1.14 - Work-life balance metrics
Description: Disclosure of metrics reflecting work-life balance for the workforce: e.g., uptake of family-related leave, flexibility arrangements, working hours distribution, employee satisfaction or turnover related to balance.

Level 2: S1.15 - Remuneration metrics
Description: Disclosure of remuneration-related metrics: e.g., gender pay gap, ratio of highest paid individual to median employee salary, total compensation figures, bonus structure, transparency of pay practices.

Level 2: S1.16 - Incidents of discrimination and other human rights incidents
Description: Disclosure of the number and nature of incidents of discrimination, complaints, and other severe human-rights-related incidents within the company’s own workforce, including any sanctions or corrective actions.

Level 1: S2 - Workers in the Value Chain
Level 2: S2.1 - Policies related to value chain workers
Description: Policies adopted by the company to identify, prevent, mitigate and remediate its material impacts on workers in its upstream and downstream value chain (who are not part of its own workforce), including respect for labour rights, decent working conditions, and human rights due diligence.

Level 1: S2 - Workers in the Value Chain
Level 2: S2.2 - Value chain worker engagement, grievance channels, and remediation
Description: Description of how the company engages with workers in its value chain (directly or through suppliers, intermediaries or worker representatives), the mechanisms available for them to raise concerns or report grievances, and how the company assesses, responds to and remediates those issues.

Level 1: S2 - Workers in the Value Chain
Level 2: S2.3 - Actions and resources related to value chain workers
Description: Explanation of the key actions the company has taken or plans to take to manage material impacts, risks and opportunities related to value chain workers, including supplier capacity-building, audits, training, living-wage initiatives, and the financial or human resources allocated to these actions.

Level 1: S2 - Workers in the Value Chain
Level 2: S2.4 - Targets related to value chain workers
Description: Disclosure of the time-bound targets the company has set to address material impacts on value chain workers (for example, elimination of child or forced labour, ensuring living wages, or improving health and safety in supply chains), including baseline, scope, progress and performance tracking.

Level 2: S3.1 - Policies related to affected communities
Description: Policies adopted by the company to identify, prevent, mitigate and remediate material impacts on affected communities, including respect for human rights, land and resource rights, cultural heritage, and the rights of indigenous peoples and vulnerable groups.

Level 2: S3.2 - Engagement and grievance mechanisms for affected communities
Description: Description of how the company engages with affected communities and other local stakeholders about actual or potential impacts, including consultation processes, grievance and remedy mechanisms, and how the company ensures accessibility, inclusivity and effectiveness of these channels.

Level 2: S3.3 - Actions and resources related to affected communities
Description: Explanation of the key actions taken and planned by the company to manage material impacts, risks and opportunities related to affected communities (for example, impact assessments, community investment, capacity building, or relocation programmes) and the resources allocated to these actions.

Level 2: S3.4 - Targets related to affected communities
Description: Disclosure of the time-bound targets set by the company to address its material impacts on affected communities (for example, reducing negative environmental or social impacts, improving local livelihoods or participation), including scope, baseline, progress and measurement approach.

Level 2: S4.1 - Policies related to consumers and end-users
Description: Policies adopted by the company to identify, prevent, mitigate and remediate its material impacts on consumers and end-users, including those relating to product safety, data protection and privacy, responsible marketing, accessibility, and consumer rights.

Level 2: S4.2 - Consumer and end-user engagement, grievance channels, and remediation
Description: Description of how the company engages with consumers and end-users about its actual or potential impacts, the mechanisms available for them to raise concerns or complaints (e.g., feedback, grievance, or redress channels), and how the company ensures these channels are effective and outcomes are addressed.

Level 2: S4.3 - Actions and resources related to consumers and end-users
Description: Explanation of the key actions taken and planned to implement the company’s consumer- and end-user-related policies, including measures to ensure product safety, ethical marketing, accessibility, data security, and after-sales responsibility, and the resources allocated to these actions.

Level 2: S4.4 - Targets related to consumers and end-users
Description: Disclosure of the time-bound targets the company has adopted to manage its material impacts on consumers and end-users-such as reducing incidents of product non-compliance, improving customer satisfaction or accessibility, or strengthening data-protection practices-and the baseline, progress and measurement methods used.

Level 2: G1.1 - Policies related to business conduct
Description: Policies adopted by the company to identify, prevent, mitigate and remediate its material impacts, risks and opportunities related to business conduct - including ethics, integrity, anti-corruption and bribery, fair competition, political engagement and responsible lobbying.

Level 2: G1.2 - Actions related to business conduct
Description: Description of the key actions taken and planned to implement the business-conduct policies, such as employee training, due-diligence systems, supplier or partner screening, incident investigation procedures, and the allocation of resources to these actions.

Level 2: G1.3 - Targets related to business conduct
Description: Disclosure of the targets established to strengthen responsible business conduct (for example, achieving zero corruption incidents, 100 % staff training coverage, or improved payment-practice performance), including baselines, time frames and progress toward these goals.

Level 2: G1.4 - Metrics related to Incidents of corruption or bribery
Description: Quantitative and qualitative disclosure of incidents of corruption or bribery identified, investigated or sanctioned during the reporting period, as well as measures implemented to address or prevent recurrence.

Level 2: G1.5 - Metrics related to political influence and lobbying activities
Description: Disclosure of metrics and qualitative information on the company’s political-influence activities - including lobbying expenditures, political donations, participation in trade associations, and alignment between lobbying positions and stated sustainability commitments.

Level 2: G1.6 - Metrics in relation to payment practices
Description: Disclosure of indicators and contextual information about the company’s payment practices toward suppliers and other creditors, such as average payment times, proportion of late payments, adherence to payment-term policies, and initiatives to ensure fair payment to small and medium-sized enterprises.

Level 2: BP.1 - Basis for preparation of the sustainability statement
Description: Explains how the sustainability statement has been prepared, including reporting boundaries, period, and consolidation approach.

Level 2: BP.2 - Specific information if the company uses phasing-in options
Description: Specifies whether the company uses any phasing-in options under ESRS and how these affect reported disclosures.

Level 2: GOV.1 - The role of the administrative, management and supervisory bodies in relation to sustainability
Description: Describes the governance body’s roles, responsibilities, and oversight of sustainability matters.

Level 2: GOV.2 - Integration of sustainability-related performance in incentive schemes
Description: Explains how sustainability objectives are linked to management or employee remuneration and incentive systems.

Level 2: GOV.3 - Statement on due diligence
Description: Provides a statement on the company’s due-diligence process for identifying, preventing, mitigating and remediating material impacts, risks and opportunities.

Level 2: GOV.4 - Risk management and internal controls over sustainability reporting
Description: Describes internal control and risk-management systems ensuring reliability of sustainability data and reporting.

Level 2: SBM.1 - Strategy, business model and value chain
Description: Explains the company’s strategy and business model, including how sustainability considerations are embedded across the value chain.

Level 2: SBM.2 - Interests and views of stakeholders
Description: Describes how stakeholder perspectives inform the company’s strategy, business model and materiality assessment

Level 2: SBM.3 - Interaction of material impacts risks and opportunities with strategy and business model, and financial effects
Description: Explains how sustainability impacts, risks and opportunities influence the business model, strategy, and financial performance.

Level 2: IRO.1 - Process for determining material impacts, risks, and opportunities
Description: Outlines the process and criteria used for materiality assessment and determining what sustainability information to disclose.

Level 2: IRO.2 - Material impacts, risks and opportunities and disclosure requirements included in the sustainability statement
Description: Lists the material impacts, risks and opportunities identified and links them to the relevant disclosure requirements reported.

Level 2: GDR-P - Policies related to material impacts, risks and opportunities
Description: Summarises the policies addressing material sustainability impacts, risks and opportunities.

Level 2: GDR-A - Actions and resources related to material impacts, risks and opportunities
Description: Describes the key actions taken or planned and the resources allocated to manage material impacts, risks and opportunities.

Level 2: GDR-M - Metrics related to material impacts, risks and opportunities
Description: Discloses quantitative and qualitative metrics used to monitor and evaluate performance regarding material impacts, risks and opportunities.

Level 2: GDR-T - Targets related to material impacts, risks and opportunities
Description: Provides the targets set to manage material impacts, risks and opportunities, including baselines, timeframes and progress.
